title: Welcome!
text:
¿Qué aprenderemos?
Al final del taller, los participantes podrán:

Usar el paquete de Neotoma2 para encontrar sitios en la Base de Datos


En estos módulos aprenderemos a usar Neotoma2

title: Welcome!
text:
Prerequisitos
Si deseas instalar Neotoma2 en tu setup de R, sigue los siguientes pasos:

title: 2.1. Exercises
text:
Your First Plot
Instructions: Be patient when running a coding exercise for the first time, it can take a few minutes.
When you see ____ in a coding exercise, replace it with what you assume to be the correct code. Run the code to see if you obtain the desired output and submit it to validate if you were correct.
Let’s use the same vehicle dataset we saw in the lecture, but visualize the relationship between two different columns.
The data has already been imported for you in this exercise.
Here is what it looks like:
# Setup environment and install neotoma2 from your hosted repo
install.packages(
  "neotoma2",
  repos = c("https://sedv8808.github.io/trial/webr_repo", "https://webr.r-wasm.org/cran"),
  type = "source"
)












Tasks:

Fill out the missing fields in the Altair plot in order to create a scatter plot.
The cars’ Horsepower should be on the y-axis and their Weight_in_lbs on the x-axis.
Color the points by the Origin of the cars.
















Hint 1





Are the column names expressed in quotes, e.g. y='Horsepower'?

title: What is Data Visualization?
text:
Como bajar datos en Neotoma?
Los datos…

notas

title: What is Data Visualization?
section: Why bother visualizing data instead of showing raw numbers?
text:
Why bother visualizing data instead of showing raw numbers?
Can you see any differences in the general trends of these four sets of numbers?
#| echo: false
library('dplyr')
# Load the iris dataset
data(iris)
library(knitr)

# View the first few rows of the dataset
head(iris)

html_table <- kable(dfs, format = "html") %>%
  # Apply styling to the table
  gsub('class="dataframe"', 'style="width:70px; float:left; margin-right:40px"', .) %>%
  # Modify the header style
  gsub('<thead>', '<thead style="text-align: center">', .)

# Print the styled HTML table
html_table

,,, which was put together by statistician Francis Anscombe in the 70s.

title: Aggregations, lines, and layers
section: Including all the data can hinder visualization of general trends
text:
Including all the data can hinder visualization of general trends
library(neotoma2)

sites <-get_sites(c(24,5))
sites
